answers.answer: Is your blood sugar fasting under 125, or your A1c under 6.5?

It probably means that your blood sugars are still in the 'prediabetic' stage.Truly normal a1c is < 5.0 and fasting blood sugar is < 95.The good thing is, if you catch it early you may be able to manage things with diet and exercise.  Lower carb diet and daily exercise should be very helpful.  If you can get a meter and test after eating (1.5 - 2 hrs), then you should be able to find which foods raise your sugars (ideally < 120 at 1.5 - 2 hours post testing), and then you can modify your diet appropriately.Best wishes

question: My doctor said I'm "border-line Diabetes " what does this mean? Im 52years ,female
title: Boarder line diabetes
